name: subsample_bam
usage: subsample_bam [-h] [-o OUTPUT_PREFIX] [-r REGIONS [REGIONS ...]] [-p PROFILE] [-O {fwd,rev}] [-t THREADS] [-q QUALITY] [-a ACCURACY] [-c COVERAGE] [-l LENGTH] [--any_fail | --all_fail] [-x PATIENCE] [-s STRIDE] [-P] [-S SEED] bam depth [depth ...]
description: Subsample a bam to uniform or proportional depth

options.description: show this help message and exit
Stride in genomic coordinates for depth profile. (default: 1000)
Sample only forward or reverse reads. (default: None)
Filter reads by mean qscore. (default: None)
Filter reads by coverage (what fraction of the read aligns). (default: None)
Filter reads by read length. (default: None)
Exit with an error if any region has insufficient coverage. (default: False)
Exit with an error if all regions have insufficient coverage. (default: False)
Maximum iterations with no change in median coverage before aborting. (default: 5)
Stride in genomic coordinates when searching for new reads. Smaller can lead to more compact pileup. (default: 1000)
Activate proportional sampling, thus keeping depth variations of the pileup. (default: False)
Random seed for proportional downsampling of reads. (default: None)
